title.text: A Chomsky-Schützenberger Representation for Weighted Multiple Context-free Languages

abstractContent.text: We prove a Chomsky-Schützenberger representation theorem for weighted multiple context-free languages.

introductionContent.text: Mildly context-sensitive languages receive much attention in the natural language processing community.

Many classes of mildly context-sensitive languages are subsumed by the multiple context-free languages, e.g. the languages of head grammars, linear context-free rewriting systems (, combinatory categorial grammars, linear indexed grammars, minimalist grammars,, and finite-copying lexical functional grammars (.
The Chomsky-Schützenberger (CS) representation for context-free languages has recently been generalised to quantitative context-free languages and to (unweighted) multiple context-free languages (.
In order to obtain a CS representation for multiple context-free languages, introduce multiple Dyck languages.

We give a more algebraic definition of multiple Dyck languages using congruence relations together with a decision algorithm for membership that is strongly related to these congruence relations (Sec. 3).
We then provide a CS representation for weighted multiple context-free languages (Sec. 4).
